abstract.p: Rogers Communications, Canada's largest cable television and wireless telephone company, reports its second-quarter operating loss narrowed to $9.3 million; photo (S)

block.p: Canada's largest cable television and wireless telephone company, Rogers Communications, reported a second-quarter loss of 13.6 million Canadian dollars, or $9.3 million, but said its performance was better than the second quarter of 1999. Excluding nonoperating gains for both periods, Rogers cut its loss to 17.7 million Canadian dollars, or $12 million, on revenue of 871.6 million Canadian dollars. The company's chief executive and president, Edward S. Rogers, above, said, ''The second quarter showed strong progress in all areas of the company.''
